--- In gladiator@y..., "George \"Cookie\" Phillips" <cookie@l...> 
wrote:

> BTW -- IIRC someone mentioned a while back that levels couldn't be 
custom-built.. ie, if you wanted a 5000x200 map, you'd need to use 
one of the Gladiator-provided levels and modify it, that you couldn't 
simply create your own. Is this correct? (Um.. If I'm wrong, then... 
uh... ignore this. ;))
> 

Well, that's technically correct... you have to start with some sort 
of .PIX file. But you can alter it any way you like. Scen.exe is 
limited, in that you can't change scenario size, but Editor.exe has 
that capability. It lets you change the dimensions any way you like. 
(How do you think I got those long, narrow "Aqueduct" levels?) You 
can also mirror a map top-to-bottom or left-to-right, change all 
tiles of a particular type into another type, and do a few other 
tricks. I use it a lot, even though the interface is a little funny. 
Check it out for yourself if you haven't already.
     -T.
